# pageController(_:frameFor:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the frame appropriate for displaying the specified object.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func pageController(_ pageController: NSPageController, frameFor object: Any?) -> NSRect
```

## Parameters

- **pageController**: The page controller.
- **object**: The object to display.

## Return Value

The frame appropriate for displaying `object`.

## Discussion

You only need to implement this if the view frame can differ between the page controller’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPageController/arrangedObjects].

This method must return immediately. Avoid file, network or any potentially blocking or lengthy work to provide an answer.

If this method is not implemented, all [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPageController/arrangedObjects] are assumed to have the same frame as the `pageController` object’s current [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPageController/selectedViewController] instance’s `view` or the bounds of `view` when [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPageController/selectedViewController] is `nil`.

This method is only useful if [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPageControllerDelegate/pageController(_:identifierFor:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPageControllerDelegate/pageController(_:viewControllerForIdentifier:)] are implemented.

## Managing View Controllers

- **pageController(_:identifierFor:)**: Return the identifier of the view controller that owns a view to display the object.
- **pageController(_:viewControllerForIdentifier:)**: Returns a view controller the page controller uses for managing the specified identifier.
- **pageController(_:prepare:with:)**: Prepare the view controller and it’s view for drawing.
